Use natural cues like the sun, moon, and stars to determine when to wake up, eat, and work.
Create a personal "clock" using a series of symbols or images that represent different activities or milestones in your day.
Use a system of physical cues, such as placing objects in specific locations or performing certain actions at certain times, to help you stay on track.
Work with a group of people who have agreed to use the same scheduling system, so that you can rely on each other for support and accountability.
Use a combination of technology and traditional methods, such as setting reminders on your phone and using a paper planner, to create a personalized scheduling system that works best for you.
